Package components.players

Class HumanPlayer

java.lang.Object
components.players.Player
components.players.HumanPlayer
public class HumanPlayer extends Player
The HumanPlayer class represents a human player in a card game, like Uno. It extends the Player class, providing functionality for the human player to play cards and choose colors during the game.

The player can play a card by selecting the card index from their hand, draw a card by entering -1, or declare Uno by entering -2.

The class uses a Scanner object to read input from the console.

  • Method Details

    • play

      public Card play(Card topCard)
      Overrides the play method from the Player class. Allows the human player to play a card by selecting the card index from their hand. The player can also draw a card (-1) or declare Uno (-2).
      Specified by:
      play in class Player
      Parameters:
      topCard - the current top card on the table
      Returns:
      the card played by the HumanPlayer, or null if no valid move is possible

    • chooseColor

      public Color chooseColor()
      Overrides the chooseColor method from the Player class. Allows the human player to select a color by entering 'r', 'y', 'g', or 'b'.
      Specified by:
      chooseColor in class Player
      Returns:
      the chosen color by the HumanPlayer

    • getPlayerToSwitchWith

      public int getPlayerToSwitchWith(List<Integer> handSizes, boolean forwardPlay)
      Overrides the getPlayerToSwitchWith method from the Player class. Allows the human player to select another player to switch hands with by entering the player number.
      Specified by:
      getPlayerToSwitchWith in class Player
      Parameters:
      handSizes - a list containing the sizes of hands for each player in the game
      forwardPlay - a boolean indicating the direction of play (true for forward, false for backward)
      Returns:
      the index of the player to switch hands with

    • getPlayerType

      public String getPlayerType()
      Abstract method representing the player's strategy to determine its type. The implementation of this method should return a string representing the player's type. Overrides the method to provide the type of the player. This implementation returns a string representing the player's type, which is "Human".
      Specified by:
      getPlayerType in class Player
      Returns:
      a string representing the player's type
